recovery time before the system is ready

triples.evidence: This limitation is called dead time. It reflects the fact that every detector and its electronics need a short period to reset after each event.
The system dead time, usually written as the Greek letter tau, can be expressed as the difference between the reciprocal of these two rates: tau equals one over n minus one over N.
triples.o: difference between the reciprocal of these two rates

evidence: This limitation is called dead time. It reflects the fact that every detector and its electronics need a short period to reset after each event.
The system dead time, usually written as the Greek letter tau, can be expressed as the difference between the reciprocal of these two rates: tau equals one over n minus one over N.
This formula tells us how much recovery time the system effectively needs between two detected events.
triples.o: the time between two detected events

triples.evidence: It reflects the fact that every detector and its electronics need a short period to reset after each event.
